block.p: INTERNATIONAL A3-14

House Passes Bill Requiring Troop Withdrawal from Iraq The House narrowly approved a $124 billion war spending bill that would require American troops to begin withdrawing from Iraq by Oct. 1, setting the stage for the first veto fight between President Bush and the Democratic majority. A12

The United Nations released a report accusing the Iraqi government of failing to ''seriously address'' problems of detainee abuse, including torture, and to ensure the timely and fair prosecution of detainees. A11

French Also-Ran Slams Rivals François Bayrou, who won 18 percent of the first-round vote for the French presidency, criticized the two candidates who go on to the runoff, a Socialist and a conservative, and refused to endorse either. A8

Israeli's Conduct in Question Israel's state comptroller released a report accusing the prime minister, Ehud Olmert, of improperly helping an associate during his term as minister of trade and industry. The attorney general will decide whether to begin an investigation, a spokeswoman said. A3

Yeltsin Buried in Moscow Boris N. Yeltsin, Russia's first democratically elected president, was buried after a somber, symbolic funeral service attended by Russia's political elite, current and former world leaders, family and close friends. A6
NATIONAL A16-23

Court Asked to Limit Lawyers at Guantánamo The Justice Department has asked a federal appeals court to impose tight new restrictions on the hundreds of lawyers who represent detainees at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, and the request has become a central issue in a new legal battle over the administration's detention policies.
A1

Vaccination Efforts Blocked A revolt by lawmakers has blocked Gov. Rick Perry's effort for Texas to become the first state to require sixth-grade girls to be vaccinated against a sexually transmitted virus that causes cervical cancer.

10 Killed by Tornado in Texas A fierce tornado killed at least 10 people on both sides of the Texas-Mexico border and more than 500 rescue workers searched through the rubble of Eagle Pass, southwest of San Antonio.
Hispanics Alter Catholicism The influx of Hispanic immigrants to the United States is transforming the Roman Catholic Church as well as the nation's religious landscape, according to a study.
EDUCATION

Loan Companies Criticized New York's attorney general, Andrew M. Cuomo, accused the federal Education Department of being lax in regulating the student loan industry and said criminal charges might result from his months-long investigation into ties between universities and lenders.
NEW YORK/REGION B1-7

New York Trooper Killed During Catskills Manhunt A New York State trooper was killed and another wounded in a Catskill Mountains village as they tracked down a man suspected of shooting and wounding another trooper on Tuesday, the authorities said. A body was found in the farmhouse where the man, Travis D. Trim, was believed to be hiding. A1

A New Look at Abortion Law Governor Spitzer said he planned to introduce legislation to overhaul New York's abortion law, one that predates the Roe v. Wade decision by three years but is considered out of date by abortion rights advocates. A1
ARTS E1-10

Rosie to Leave 'The View' Rosie O'Donnell, who raised both the profile and the ratings of ''The View'' this season by commandeering it as a bully pulpitfor her opinions on the Iraq war, Donald Trump, Oprah Winfrey and even her own cast mates, will leave the show in June after failing to reach a contract extension, she announced on the program.
E1
BUSINESS DAY C1-16-SAME
Dow Closes Above 13,000 Despite slow growth in earnings and a struggling housing market, the Dow Jones industrial average closed above the 13,000 mark for the first time and is up 6 percent in April.
C1
Business Digest C2
OBITUARIES C17
Bohdan Paczynski An astrophysicist whose unconventional ideas led to new methods of studying distant stars, he was 67. C17
EDITORIAL A24-25
Editorials: Another dubious firing; ranting at reality on Iraq; Medicare's troubling prospects; guns and more guns.
Columns: David Brooks, Bob Herbert.
Bridge E4 Weather A20 Crossword E2
